intro: Lepidium arcuatum, commonly known as the bentleaf peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a low, spreading growth habit. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, smooth pods that contain several seeds. Lepidium arcuatum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid environments.
